Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Intraoperative Cerebral Oxygen Monitoring and Postoperative Cognitive Dysfunction

Participants.evidence: Participants were adult cardiac surgery patients recruited from a single tertiary hospital

Intervention.evidence: The intervention involved monitoring rScO2, with the comparator being standard care without rScO2 monitoring

Objective.evidence: This study examines the relationship between intraoperative regional cerebral oxygen saturation (rScO2) and POCD

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was POCD, assessed at hospital discharge and 3 months post-surgery

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, with allocation concealed using sealed envelopes

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to physicians assessing outcomes

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 153 patients were randomised

Number_Analysed.evidence: 153 analysed at discharge and 148 at 3 months

Harms.evidence: No adverse events related to the intervention were reported
